---
title: Subclavian vein
---

# Pathway

The subclavian vein passes anterior to the [Anterior Scalene]({{< var ref-anterior-scalene.path >}})


Joins [Subclavian A]({{< var ref-subclavian-artery.path >}}) and [Inf trunk of the Brachial plexus]({{< var ref-brachial-plexus.inferior-trunk >}}) in the [thoracic outlet]({{< var ref-thoracic-outlet.path >}}) after they pass through the anterior and middle scalenes @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020


# Dysfunction

Thoracic outlet syndrome

- The Subclavian vein cannot be entrapped int he [interscalene triangle]({{< var ref-interscalene-triangle.path >}}), since it passes anterior to the [anterior scalene]({{< var ref-anterior-scalene.path >}})
